89 #define WAITING_DELAY 0.1
90 
91 
92 
94 #define MAX_WAITING_TIME 30
95 
96 
97 
99 bool start = false;
100 
101 
102 
104 actionlib::SimpleActionClient<rt2_assignment_2::GoToPointAction>* acglobal;
105

112 /********************************************/
123 bool user_interface(rt2_assignment_2::Command::Request &req, rt2_assignment_2::Command::Response &res)
124 {
125  if (req.command == "start")
126  {
127  start = true;
128  std::cout << "[state_machine] START command received. " << std::endl;
129  res.ok = true;
130  }
131  else
132  {
133  if ( start )
134  {
135  std::cout << "[state_machine] STOP command received, preempting the goal. " << std::endl;
136 
137  // cancel the running goal
138  acglobal->cancelAllGoals( );
139  res.ok = true;
140  }
141  else
142  {
143  std::cout << "[state_machine] state machine already stopped. " << std::endl;
144  res.ok = false;
145  }
146 
147  start = false;
148  }
149  return true;
150 }
151 
152 
153 
154 /********************************************/
175 void jupyter_pub( bool working, bool failure, bool goal_cancelled, float x, float y, float th, bool success, float time )
176 {
177  rt2_assignment_2::JupyterTargetInfo msg;
178 
179  msg.working = working;
180  msg.failure = failure;
181  msg.goal_cancelled = goal_cancelled;
182  msg.x = 0;
183  msg.y = 0;
184  msg.th = 0;
185  msg.success = success;
186  msg.time = time;
187 
188  global_jupy->publish( msg );
189 }
190 
191 
192 
193 /********************************************/
202 void jupyter_publish_status( bool status )
203 {
204  jupyter_pub( status, false, false, 0, 0, 0, false, -1 );
205 }
206 
207 
208 
209 /********************************************/
221 void jupyter_update_mission( rt2_assignment_2::GoToPointGoal& goal, float time )
222 {
223  jupyter_pub( true, false, false, goal.x, goal.y, goal.theta, false, time );
224 }

229 /********************************************/
236 void jupyter_target_cancelled( )
237 {
238  jupyter_pub( true, false, true, 0, 0, 0, false, -1 );
239 }
240 
241 
242 
243 /********************************************/
252 void jupyter_target_unreached( )
253 {
254  jupyter_pub( true, true, false, 0, 0, 0, false, -1 );
255 }
256 
257 
258 
259 /********************************************/
270 void jupyter_target_reached( rt2_assignment_2::GoToPointGoal& goal, float time )
271 {
272  jupyter_pub( true, false, false, goal.x, goal.y, goal.theta, true, time );
273 }

277 /********************************************/
282 int main(int argc, char **argv)
283 {
284 
285  ros::init(argc, argv, "state_machine");
286  ros::NodeHandle n;
287 
288  // provided services
289  ros::ServiceServer service = n.advertiseService("/user_interface", user_interface);
290 
291  // client
292  ros::ServiceClient client_rp = n.serviceClient<rt2_assignment_2::RandomPosition>("/position_server");
293 
294  // action
295  actionlib::SimpleActionClient<rt2_assignment_2::GoToPointAction> ac( "go_to_point", true );
296  acglobal = &ac; // share the access to the action
297  ac.waitForServer( );
298 
299  // infos for Jupyter interface
300  ros::Publisher jupy = n.advertise<rt2_assignment_2::JupyterTargetInfo>( "/jupyter_mission_info", 1000 );
301  global_jupy = &jupy;
302 
303  // bounds for the random target
304  rt2_assignment_2::RandomPosition rp;
305  rp.request.x_max = 5.0;
306  rp.request.x_min = -5.0;
307  rp.request.y_max = 5.0;
308  rp.request.y_min = -5.0;
309  rt2_assignment_2::Position p;
310 
311  // useful
312  rt2_assignment_2::GoToPointGoal empty_goal;
313 
314  // init the state of the GUI
315  jupyter_publish_status( false );
316 
317  while( ros::ok() )
318  {
319  ros::spinOnce();
320 
321  // execute this only if the node is enabled
322  if (start)
323  {
324  jupyter_publish_status( true );
325 
326  // ask for a random target
327  client_rp.call(rp);
328 
329  // prepare the request to the movement action
330  rt2_assignment_2::GoToPointGoal goal;
331  goal.x = rp.response.x;
332  goal.y = rp.response.y;
333  goal.theta = rp.response.theta;
334  std::cout << "NEXT TARGET (" << goal.x << ", " << goal.y << ", " << goal.theta << ")" << std::endl;
335 
336  // the target is requested to the movemet action: the robot starts to move
337  ac.sendGoal( goal );
338 
339  // waiting for the robot to reach the goal unless any preemption request
340  bool success = false;
341  float timeFromStart = 0.f;
342  std::string state = "ACTIVE";
343  while( state != "SUCCEEDED" )
344  {
345  // wait the minimum time
346  (ros::Duration(WAITING_DELAY)).sleep();
347 
348  // update the status of the node
349  ros::spinOnce();
350  timeFromStart += WAITING_DELAY;
351  state = ac.getState( ).toString( );
352 
353  // evaluate the new state
354  if( state == "PREEMPTED" )
355  {
356  std::cout << "The goal has been cancelled. " << std::endl;
357  jupyter_target_cancelled( );
358  break;
359  }
360  else if( timeFromStart > MAX_WAITING_TIME )
361  {
362  std::cout << "Unable to reach the final position within the deadline. " << std::endl;
363  jupyter_target_unreached( );
364  break;
365  }
366 
367  // send the status to Jupyter GUI
368  jupyter_update_mission( goal, timeFromStart );
369 
370  }
371  success = ( state == "SUCCEEDED" );
372 
373  if( success )
374  {
375  std::cout << "Position reached" << std::endl;
376  jupyter_target_reached( goal, timeFromStart );
377  }
378  else
379  {
380  std::cout << "Final goal not reached" << std::endl;
381  }
382  }
383  else
384  {
385  jupyter_publish_status( false );
386  }
387 
388 
389  }
390  return 0;
391 }
